channel.title: I Get this error when cxompileing a surver what does it mean and what do i do?
channel.description: ======================== Type C For Compile ======================== Type any other to close Option:c server.java:256: unclosed string literal misc.println("Crest-Scape ^ server.java:256: ';' expected misc.println("Crest-Scape ^ server.java:257: unclosed string literal ! - Crest-Scape.zapto.org"); ^ server.java:257: not a statement ! - Crest-Scape.zapto.org"); ^ 4 errors Press any key to continue . . . Option:

item.title: I Get this error when cxompileing a surver what does it mean and what do i do?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

miah102:

Thanks man Rep++

You cant even rep so what was the point in posting that? Also, The compiler tells you what line, and file the error is in before it tells you what kind of error it is. Just read the compilers errors and you wont need to ask.

Read full topic

item.title: I Get this error when cxompileing a surver what does it mean and what do i do?
item.dc:creator: @L0ST_PK3R L0ST PK3R
item.description:
@L0ST_PK3R wrote:

ok… first of all… you need to SEE what the ERRORS are… so look where they’re located change back what “you’ve” changed and try to recompile, once that’s fine, try to type you’re commands/login.java/ w/e it is… in the “[type]” - it is a lot easier, normally that’s what they’re used for, try not to type outside of the important “”'s, thank’s - L0ST PK3R [Own my own 508 server] - DESRIPTION - not aloud to add here as A post.

Read full topic

item.title: I Get this error when cxompileing a surver what does it mean and what do i do?
item.dc:creator: @Arightwizard Arightwizard
item.description:
@Arightwizard wrote:

[quote=“miah102, post:1, topic:288366”]========================
Type C For Compile

Type any other to close
Option:c
server.java:256: unclosed string literal
misc.println(“Crest-Scape
^
server.java:256: ‘;’ expected
misc.println(“Crest-Scape
^
server.java:257: unclosed string literal
! - Crest-Scape.zapto.org”);
^
server.java:257: not a statement
! - Crest-Scape.zapto.org”);
^
4 errors
Press any key to continue . . .
Option:[/quote]
OK, let’s see if I can help…

  1. open server.java in notepad
  2. Click ‘edit,’ then click ‘Go to…’
  3. In the box, type 256
  4. Now, if all you have in line 256 is:
                        misc.println("Crest-Scape

Replace that with this:

                        misc.println("Crest-Scape ! - Crest-Scape.zapto.org");

Then delete the line below that. (The one that says:

! - Crest-Scape.zapto.org"); )
Hope this helps,
-Arightwizard

Read full topic
item.source: I Get this error when cxompileing a surver what does it mean and what do i do?
